channel.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
channel.description:
So the reviews are out and so far the consensus is that it is a fantastic game.
[url]https://www.vg247.com/2011/08/22/deus-exhuman-revolution-reviews-go-live-all-the-scores/[/url]
I'm so fucking stoked about this game but why do Europeans have to wait 3 extra days to play it? That's so unfair!

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
No word on any new DLC yet, but I also thought Missing Link was pretty great. I’d definitely be down for more.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Kaweebo
item.description:
DethklokSoldier:

Agreed. Lets all go fire bomb EA and Activision for being money grubbing assholes.

Oh boy, can I?

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: vand3537
item.description:
so, does anyone know if there will be any more DLC for Deus Ex?

Missing Link was actually quite enjoyable, I want some more.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: DethklokSoldier
item.description:
geekofalltrades:

You know how big publishing companies like EA push out a lot of games on schedule that require patching later, and then DLCs come out that are exactly the way you describe? You know how Valve constantly delay their games, but then deliver a complete and polished product? Don’t knock the game designers; they aren’t cutting hours of gameplay intentionally. It’s the publishers you should be pissed at.

Agreed. Lets all go fire bomb EA and Activision for being money grubbing assholes.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Phobos001
item.description:
Solokiller:

It’s too bad that there aren’t any cheats in the game, i’d love to turn on god mode and infinite energy to start punching people all over.

If you have the PC, there is a Debug Menu mod for a specific patch of the game that lets you do this!

In fact, I’m going to do it now.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
DethklokSoldier:

I don’t feel entitled to anything, I’m just annoyed with the fact that companies are deliberately cutting hours of game play out of the game and then making you pay for it later. This is something that was obviously in the works while they were making the game originally, and they decided to be greedy assholes and make us pay more for it. So its not really the DLC I’m annoyed with, its the company behind it.

You know how big publishing companies like EA push out a lot of games on schedule that require patching later, and then DLCs come out that are exactly the way you describe? You know how Valve constantly delay their games, but then deliver a complete and polished product? Don’t knock the game designers; they aren’t cutting hours of gameplay intentionally. It’s the publishers you should be pissed at.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
They have to make money. That means they can only spend so much time working on a game without risking large amounts of money. They have to stop sometime, and content will be cut. Thats just how it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: DethklokSoldier
item.description:
I don’t feel entitled to anything, I’m just annoyed with the fact that companies are deliberately cutting hours of game play out of the game and then making you pay for it later. This is something that was obviously in the works while they were making the game originally, and they decided to be greedy assholes and make us pay more for it. So its not really the DLC I’m annoyed with, its the company behind it.

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
When you pay for the game? They owe you a game.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
Someonerandm:

Remember, game companies owe you nothing but a game.

Actually, they don’t owe you jack-shit. :meh:

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Nope, its not. See, cut content isn’t cut so they can make DLC, its cut because they ran out of developing time. DLC gives us the opportunity to play it while the company still makes money.

Remember, game companies owe you nothing but a game. Don’t act entitled.

If they release the two cut hubs I’ll buy that in a second.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: DethklokSoldier
item.description:
Maxey:

That kind of DLC is just dumb.

Content that was obviously ripped from the game and repackaged as DLC in order to squeeze more money out of the consumers is dumb. People are still going to buy it though.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
That kind of DLC is just dumb.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
There’s going to be new DLC incoming for HR that I think is going to fit in between Hengsha 2 and Singapore. “The Missing Link,” eh? Sounds like Sequences 12 and 13 with regards to Assassin’s Creed 2’s plot.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
I’ve been procrastinating on this game for a while but today I’ve finally beat it.

If you ignore the shitty boss battles, this is one of the strongest candidates for GotY 2011.

Unless Eidos-Montreal is planning on doing a sequel that directly bridges the plot of HR with that of DX1’s, I don’t much see the point of choosing between different endings since they won’t influence the plot of the first one anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: lambda
item.description:
2 thinks I can say about it:

-It’s the best game I’ve played in 2011 so far.
-Lemon Lime.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Awesomeness
item.description:
Just completed the game. Fucking amazing game! I must say that the boss battles was quite hard thou. The rest of the game was pretty easy, but still amazingly fun. Loved the storyline and the sneaking. I would personally give it 10/10

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
gibbelin:

Yeah, that code goes all the way back to System Shock 1. It’s a Ray Bradbury reference.

Ah, that would make sense.

And yeah, I think its in the tutorial and that storage room.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
blackout:

ok that makes no sense to me… having been playing this game for a while, I’ve been finding it really hard, in fact so hard it’s comprimising my enjoyment of the game. and yet I’m hearing its too easy?..

It was challenging for me for a while, but when you learn what to do it gets quite easy. I can give you some tips if you like…

Medevilae:

Did you save [COLOR=‘Black’]Malik during the part where the B-EE is downed in China? on ‘Give me Deus Ex’?

Yep.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
Someonerandm:

Just noticed the code in the beginning is the same one for that supply closet next to the helipad in Deus Ex. Just thought I’d mention that.

Yeah, that code goes all the way back to System Shock 1. It’s a Ray Bradbury reference.

Read full topic

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: Solokiller
item.description:
There are a lot of those kinds of references to the original Deus ex, and i’m noticing this because i’m only now playing the original.

Read full topic

Just noticed the code in the beginning is the same one for that supply closet next to the helipad in Deus Ex. Just thought I’d mention that.

Is it? I thought it was the code for the keypad during training in the original Deus Ex.

item.title: Deus Ex Human Revolution
item.dc:creator: blackout
item.description:
gibbelin:

I also found it really difficult on the first playthrough. Those bastards had to call it Give Me Deus Ex though, so I stuck with it and got the achievement.

the irony is that I’m playing on ‘tell me a story’
